title: ICT-Based Science Inquiry Project Design for Secondary Education

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Emphasizes ICT tool utilization for scientific problem-solving in a BYOD environment, with team-based projects and peer evaluations.

learning_goals: Students can utilize spreadsheets and data visualization tools with over 80% accuracy to analyze scientific experiment data.
Teams can design ICT-based scientific inquiry projects (e.g., climate change simulations) and create presentation materials.

Learners will collaborate with 3-4 team members using Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, etc.) to perform real-time document sharing and feedback, completing at least two collaborative tasks (e.g., scientific lab reports) within two weeks, meeting four or more of five peer evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
